meanings.definition: A phenomenon believed to foretell the future.
meanings.sent1: The black cat crossing my path was considered an omen of bad luck.
meanings.sent2: The sudden rainstorm was seen as an omen of the upcoming harvest.
meanings.sent3: The omen of a broken mirror made everyone laugh nervously.
meanings.sent4: The howling wind outside was an omen of the coming storm.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the forest felt like an omen of something ominous.

meanings.definition: A sign or warning of a future event.
meanings.sent1: Seeing a shooting star is often seen as an omen of good fortune.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds gathering on the horizon were considered an omen of a storm.
meanings.sent3: The sudden appearance of a black cat was a playful omen of mischief.
meanings.sent4: The flickering streetlight was an omen of the impending power outage.
meanings.sent5: The owl hooting at night felt like an omen of mystery and magic.

meanings.definition: To be a sign or warning of a future event.
meanings.sent1: The howling of the wolves ominously omens danger in the night.
meanings.sent2: The sudden drop in temperature omens the arrival of winter.
meanings.sent3: The creaking floorboard ominously omens the arrival of a mischievous ghost.
meanings.sent4: The flickering candle omens the end of the evening's festivities.
meanings.sent5: The distant thunder omens the approaching storm.
